com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenObjectTextBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectBase
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectTextBox

  • public class SpenObjectTextBox
extends SpenObjectBase
    This class represents a text box and provides methods for managing text boxes.

      the action key performs a "done" operation, typically meaning the IME will be closed.
      static int IME_ACTION_GO
      the action key performs a "go" operation to take the user to the target of the text they typed.
      static int IME_ACTION_NEXT
      the action key performs a "next" operation, taking the user to the next field that will accept text.
      static int IME_ACTION_NONE
      there is no available action.
      static int IME_ACTION_SEARCH
      the action key performs a "search" operation, taking the user to the results of searching for the text the have typed (in whatever context is appropriate).
      static int IME_ACTION_SEND
      the action key performs a "send" operation, delivering the text to its target.
      static int IME_ACTION_UNSPECIFIED
      no specific action has been associated with this editor, let the editor come up with its own if it can.
      static int IMEACTION_PREVIOUS
      Like IME_ACTION_NEXT, but for moving to the previous field.

      dates and times.

    • Method Detail

      • setRect

        public void setRect(RectF rect,
           boolean regionOnly)
        Set the specified rectangle of the region.
        Object forwards the regionOnly parameter to ObjectBase.
        Overrides:
        setRect in class SpenObjectBase
        Parameters:
        rect - The rectangle of region.
        regionOnly - Set to true to not allow the internal data to be changed, set to false to let rectangle change the internal data.

      • setText

        public void setText(String text)
        Set the specified text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text.

      • getText

        public String getText()
        Get the current text.
        Returns:
        The current text.

      • insertText

        public void insertText(String text,
              int position)
        Insert the specified text at the specified position in the text box.
        If the parameter is negative or larger than the length of the entire text, an exception is thrown.
        In the new text, the span style follows the existing text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to insert.
        position - The position in the text box to insert the text.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the position is negative or larger than the text box length.
        See Also:
        insertTextAtCursor(String)

      • insertTextAtCursor

        public void insertTextAtCursor(String text)
        Insert the specified text at the current cursor position.
        After insertion, the cursor moves to the end of the new text.
        In the new text, the span style follows the existing text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to insert.
        See Also:
        insertText(String, int)

      • removeText

        public void removeText(int startPosition,
              int length)
        Delete the text specified by the starting position and length.
        If startPosition is negative or larger than the length of the entire text, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        startPosition - The start index of the text to be deleted.
        length - The length of the text to be deleted.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If startPosition is negative or sum of length and startPosition is larger than the text box length.

      • removeAllText

        public void removeAllText()
        Delete the entire text including span and paragraph data.

      • replaceText

        public void replaceText(String text,
               int startPosition,
               int length)
        Replace the text specified by the starting position and length with the new text.
        Span and paragraph data are retained and applied to the new text.
        Parameters:
        text - The new text.
        startPosition - The start index of the text to be replaced.
        length - The length of the text to be replaced.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If startPosition and length passed are invalid.

      • setCursorPos

        public void setCursorPos(int position)
        Set the cursor at the specified position. If the position is less than 0 or larger than the length of the entire text, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        position - The cursor position
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If position passed is negative or larger than the length of the entire text.
        See Also:
        getCursorPos()

      • getCursorPos

        public int getCursorPos()
        Get cursor position.
        Returns:
        the cursor position
        See Also:
        setCursorPos(int)

      • setSpan

        public void setSpan(ArrayList<SpenObjectTextBox.TextSpanInfo> span)
        Set the specified text span information. If the new span and the existing span share a type and their regions overlap, the span overlap region is merged internally.
        So the span value that is set and the span value that is got may not both always match.
        Parameters:
        span - The text span information.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if startPos or endPos of TextSpanInfo has a negative value.

      • getSpan

        public ArrayList<SpenObjectTextBox.TextSpanInfo> getSpan()
        Get the text span information.
        Returns:
        The text span information.

      • findSpans

        public ArrayList<SpenObjectTextBox.TextSpanInfo> findSpans(int startPos,
                                                  int endPos)
        Find the list of spans between the specified start position and end position.
        Parameters:
        startPos - The index of the first character for finding span information.
        endPos - The index of the last character for finding span information.
        Returns:
        The list of span information.

      • removeSpan

        public void removeSpan(SpenObjectTextBox.TextSpanInfo span)
        Remove the specified spans in the text.
        Parameters:
        span - The span instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the span passed is null.

      • appendSpan

        public void appendSpan(SpenObjectTextBox.TextSpanInfo span)
        Add the specified span information.
        Where there are existing spans, this method merges the new span with the existing spans.
        Parameters:
        span - The span instance.

      • setParagraph

        public void setParagraph(ArrayList<SpenObjectTextBox.TextParagraphInfo> paragraph)
        Set the specified text paragraph information for each text line.
        If the new paragraph and the existing paragraph share a type and their regions overlap, the paragraph overlaps are merged internally.
        So the paragraph value that is set and the paragraph value that is got may not always match.
        Parameters:
        paragraph - The paragraph information.

      • getParagraph

        public ArrayList<SpenObjectTextBox.TextParagraphInfo> getParagraph()
        Get the text paragraph information of each text line.
        Returns:
        The list of current text paragraph information objects of each text line.

      • findParagraphs

        public ArrayList<SpenObjectTextBox.TextParagraphInfo> findParagraphs(int startPos,
                                                            int endPos)
        Find the list of paragraphs between the specified start position and end position.
        Parameters:
        startPos - The index of the first character for finding paragraph information.
        endPos - The index of the end character for finding paragraph information.
        Returns:
        The list of paragraph information objects.

      • removeParagraph

        public void removeParagraph(SpenObjectTextBox.TextParagraphInfo paragraph)
        Remove the specified paragraph from the text.
        Parameters:
        paragraph - The paragraph object to remove.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown If paragraph passed is null.

      • appendParagraph

        public void appendParagraph(SpenObjectTextBox.TextParagraphInfo paragraph)
        Add the specified paragraph.
        Where the new paragraph overlaps with an existing paragraph, the new paragraph is merged with the existing one.
        Parameters:
        paragraph - The paragraph object to append.

        Parameters:

      • isReadOnlyEnabled

        public boolean isReadOnlyEnabled()
        Check if the text box is read-only.
        you can edit textbox even if the read-only property set to true. SpenObjectTextBox is just save the read-only property.
        Returns:
        true or false. If true, The ObjectTextBox is a "read-only".

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(int color)
        Set the specified font color for normal format text.
        For rich format text, use the span classes to set the font attributes.
        If you use this method for rich format text, the existing font colors and span data are deleted.
        Parameters:
        color - The ARGB8888 format color.
        See Also:
        getTextColor()

      • getTextColor

        public int getTextColor()
        Get the font color of the normal format text.
        For rich format text, use the span classes to set the font attributes.
        This method gets the text color where the cursor is positioned.
        Returns:
        text color. (ARGB8888 format)
        See Also:
        setTextColor(int color)

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(float size)
        Set the specified font size for normal format text.
        The default size is 10. For rich format text, use the span classes to set the font attributes.
        If you use this method for rich format text, the existing font size and span data are deleted.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If size is less than 0.
        See Also:

      • getDrawnRect

        public RectF getDrawnRect()
        Description copied from class: SpenObjectBase
        Get the region that the rectangle takes up in the viewport. If an object got rectangle(1, 1, 2, 4) is rotated by 90 degrees using setRotate(90), rectangle is still (1, 1, 2, 4) but DrawnRect is (0, 2, 5, 3).
        Overrides:
        getDrawnRect in class SpenObjectBase
        Returns:
        The viewing object area.
        See Also:
        SpenObjectBase.getRect()
